concept.title: AMF support for N3IWF and non-3GPP access - phase 2 (Feature f20059-08)
concept.shortdesc: With this feature, the AMF supports CM-IDLE to CM-CONNECTED state transition for non-3GPP access, for example, through service request, paging or notification, as well as the possibility for the PDU switching from non-3GPP access to 3GPP access. This feature also modifies PCF handling and supports UE policy association for non-3GPP access.

ul.li: PDU-related network-triggered interactions when a UE is registered over both 3GPP and non-3GPP access.
Paging via 3GPP access when the UE is in CM-IDLE state over non-3GPP access.
NAS notification over both 3GPP and non-3GPP accesses when the UE is in CM-IDLE state over the triggering access.

conbody.p: This feature supports the following procedures:

ul.li: UE-triggered service request for non-3GPP access for signaling connection and data activation.

Network-triggered service request for non-3GPP access. Notification or paging depending on the RM/CM states. NAS notification is a new procedure for a UE registered in both 3GPP and non-3GPP access, and it is used instead of paging when there is a network (SMF) trigger (N1N2MessageTransfer) for one access in which the UE is in CM-IDLE state while the UE is in CM-CONNECTED state on other access. In that case, a downlink NAS message containing the NAS notification is sent on behalf of the idle access, on the connected access. The notification procedure can serve both 3GPP and non-3GPP accesses. Note that paging over non-3GPP access is not supported.

PDU switching in registration procedure/service request to the 3GPP access as response to paging/notification for non-3GPP access. For example, when the SMF sends trigger for a PDU last routed over non-3GPP access, but the UE is currently outside of the non-3GPP access coverage, thus, the PDU can be switched to 3GPP access, if allowed by the UE policy.

PCF selection, AM/UE policy association for non-3GPP access. For the UE that is already registered in an AMF (on whatever access, 3GPP or non-3GPP) with existing PCF association (AM/UE), the AMF does not create/update the PCF association for the new access type.
